title: Invalid diagnostic suggestion when coercing `&mut _` to `&_`

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=9e4ef3227ccd2cf2b6bd1146458463b3

```rust
use std::collections::HashMap;

fn foo(mut foo: HashMap<i32, String>) {
    let x: &HashMap<i32, String> = &mut foo;
    x.insert(1, String::new());
}
```

The current output is, which is not valid Rust code if applied like suggested:

```
error[E0596]: cannot borrow `*x` as mutable, as it is behind a `&` reference
 --> src/lib.rs:5:5
  |
4 |     let x: &HashMap<i32, String> = &mut foo;
  |                                    -------- help: consider changing this to be a mutable reference: `&mut mut foo`
5 |     x.insert(1, String::new());
  |     ^ `x` is a `&` reference, so the data it refers to cannot be borrowed as mutable

error: aborting due to previous error
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally the output should look like:

```
error[E0596]: cannot borrow `*x` as mutable, as it is behind a `&` reference
 --> src/lib.rs:5:5
  |
4 |     let x: &HashMap<i32, String> = &mut foo;
  |            --------------------- help: consider changing this to be a mutable reference: `&mut _`
5 |     x.insert(1, String::new());
  |     ^ `x` is a `&` reference, so the data it refers to cannot be borrowed as mutable

error: aborting due to previous error
```
